comment.author: 15283643@N04
comment._content: The trucks look like they were made by the White Motor Company of Cleveland.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: technogeo:  Could you give us a little more information on why you think these trucks were made by the White Motor Company? It would be great to identify them!

comment.author: 15283643@N04
comment._content:
The contoured shape of the radiator shell and hood suggest these are White trucks. The shape is almost identical on White steam cars, made from 1900 to 1910. (White steamers were the official cars of President Taft and his staff). The hexagonal bronze hub caps are also typical of White cars. The name "White," engraved in script, is just visible on the front wheel's hub cap in the high-res version.

The White Motor Company switched production to internal combustion cars and trucks in 1910.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: New York National Guard troops in training at summer camp outside Hicksville, Long Island, in 1913. Also: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3739602350/in/p... Note date inscribed on negative (in reverse) in lower right corner.
